intro: Iberis intermedia var. delphinensis, commonly known as the Delphinian candytuft, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy, lobed leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate flowers and compact form.
